content.description: Mantels lead to a tricky crux sequence culminating with a big jump move from a pair of slopers.  Continue with more steep pulling, a short slab, then a final steep section with fun compression moves.
content.protection: 6 bolts to chain anchors. An optional #.75 Camalot can sew up relatively easy climbing between 4th and 5th bolts. The sloping ledge below the crux might appear hazardous for the falling leader, but it's actually a clean fall - the rock is steeper than it looks.
content.location: The farthest left route on the wall, immediately left of Cool Your Jets.

content.description: Funky stems to reach the first bolt then a series of steep bulges with good rests in between.  The crux is at the 5th bolt and is very well protected, above a small roof with a nice clean fall.
content.protection: 7 bolts to chains. Optional 0.5 Camalot above the last bolt where it gets relatively easy.

content.description: Follow 7 right-trending bolts up an overhanging weakness. Turn the lip for a no hands slab move, followed by a roof to the finish. A forgotten classic.
content.location: West of Pentapitch above the creek. Shady and cool all the time.

content.description: The direct line up the steepest part of the wall. Branch left after the 2nd bolt of Cool Your Jets then hook, squeeze, and slap your way up the center prow. Press out a mantel and recover – a final crux awaits at the lip of the alcove.
content.location: Starts on Cool Your Jets and goes left

content.description:
Finally, a quasi warm up for its much more difficult neighbors to the south! No, not Mexico. Cool your Jets and Kidsmoke.

The crux is near the top with some small holds and a smear or two. Cool sidepulls and long reaches seem to be the name of your own personal loss here.
content.location: Located just across the pool at the bottom of the waterfall
